PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_ElectricalDeviceCommon
PropertySetDef.Definition: Definition from IAI: A means of collecting together all properties that are commonly used by electrical devices.

PropertyDef.Name: NominalCurrent
PropertyDef.Definition: The maximum allowed current that a device is certified to handle.

PropertyDef.Name: UsageCurrent
PropertyDef.Definition: The current that a device is actually handling or is calculated to be handling at a point in time.

PropertyDef.Name: NominalVoltage
PropertyDef.Definition: The range of allowed voltage that a device is certified to handle. The upper bound of this value is the maximum.

PropertyDef.Name: ElectricalDeviceNominalPower
PropertyDef.Definition: The output power rating that is certified for a device.

PropertyDef.Name: NumberOfPoles
PropertyDef.Definition: The number of logical connections that can be made on an electrical device.

PropertyDef.Name: HasProtectiveEarth
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates whether the electrical device has a protective earth connection (=TRUE) or not (= FALSE).

PropertyDef.Name: NominalFrequencyRange
PropertyDef.Definition: The upper and lower limits of frequency for which the operation of the device is certified.

PropertyDef.Name: PhaseAngle
PropertyDef.Definition: The angular difference between two waveforms of the same frequency

PropertyDef.Name: IP_Code
PropertyDef.Definition: IEC 529 (1989) Classification of degrees of protection provided by enclosures (IP Code)

PropertyDef.Name: InsulationStandardClass
PropertyDef.Definition: Insulation standard classes provides basic protection information against electric shock. Defines levels of insulation required in terms of constructional requirements (creepage and clearance distances) and electrical requirements (compliance with electric strength tests). Basic insulation is considered to be shorted under single fault conditions. The actual values required depend on the working voltage to which the insulation is subjected, as well as other factors. Also indicates whether the electrical device has a protective earth connection.

PropertyDef.Name: PhaseReference
PropertyDef.Definition: The phase identification used for the device electrical input. This should be the same phase identifier that is used for the conductor segment providing the electrical service to the device. In general, it is recommended that IEC recommendations for phase identification are used (L1, L2 etc.). However, other phase identifiers may be used such as by color (Red, Blue, Yellow) or by number (1, 2, 3) etc.
